products.name: Signal Loop
products.subtitle: Matchmaking & Discovery App
products.scope:
Background

Signal Loop is launching a discovery platform that connects people who need something with people who offer something. The goal is to reduce friction and surface relevant matches quickly. You are building the first release of the product.

The Goal

Deliver a working discovery platform that:

  • Allows users to define what they need or offer
  • Surfaces matches
  • Makes connections visible
  • Provides oversight to administrators

Core Requirements

1. Two User Types

  • Consumer (looking for something)
  • Provider (offering something)

Each must have: Profile, Status or preference settings

2. Matching Logic

  • Some logic must exist to surface matches
  • It must be explainable
  • It does not need to be advanced

3. Consumer Experience

  • View recommended matches
  • View full profile
  • Favourite or bookmark users

4. Map View

  • Display users geographically
  • Can be simple or static
  • Must be visible and functional

5. Admin View

Admin must be able to:

  • View all users in a single table
  • Filter by user type
  • Filter by match status
  • Open a user and see matches

6. Notifications

When a match is made, an email is sent

Acceptance Criteria

To be considered complete:

  • Deployed and accessible via URL
  • At least 50 seeded users
  • Matching logic works
  • Data persists
  • Admin view provides visibility
  • Core flows work end-to-end

products.name: Atlas Systems
products.subtitle: Multi-Tenant Platform Build
products.scope:
Background

Atlas Systems is building a white-label platform used by multiple enterprise clients. Each client requires: their own branded environment, isolated data, their own internal administrators, and a shared back-office view for Atlas.

Your team has been tasked with delivering the first working foundation of the Atlas platform. This is not the final product. This is the operational backbone.

The Goal

Deliver a working multi-tenant system that demonstrates:

  • Client isolation
  • Role-based access
  • Basic admin self-serve
  • Branded client environments

Core Requirements

1. Multi-Tenant Structure

  • More than one client must exist
  • Each client must only see their own data
  • Switching clients must clearly change context

2. Roles & Access

At minimum: Internal Admin (Atlas back-office), Client Admin, Client User. Each role should see appropriate navigation and data.

3. Internal Admin View

Navigation: Dashboard, Settings, Profile

Dashboard: Aggregated view across all clients, Charts or metrics (data can be mock or randomised), Ability to filter by client

Settings: View list of clients, Create new client, Update client branding (name, colour, logo), Import client users (any reasonable format)

4. Client View

Navigation: Dashboard, Profile

Dashboard: Only client-specific data, Client branding applied

Acceptance Criteria

To be considered complete:

  • Two or more tenants exist
  • Role-based views function
  • Client branding updates reflect in tenant view
  • Internal admin can view and manage clients
  • Core flows work end-to-end without demo tricks

products.name: Mainframe
products.subtitle: IMD Accelerator Regression & Stability Build
products.scope:
Background

Mainframe is responsible for protecting the integrity of the IMD Accelerator system. The platform is evolving rapidly, and regressions are becoming increasingly costly. Your team has been assigned to build a working automated regression system to improve system stability and visibility.

The Goal

Deliver an automated regression solution that:

  • Tests critical flows
  • Surfaces failures
  • Provides visibility into system health

Core Requirements

1. Test Coverage

Identify and automate tests for: Core user flows, Admin functionality, Data operations

2. Automation

  • Tests must run automatically
  • Must produce clear pass/fail output
  • Must be repeatable

3. Reporting

  • Clear reporting of results
  • Easy visibility of failures
  • Logs or summaries available

4. Stability Focus

  • Tests must validate real behaviour
  • Not superficial or cosmetic checks

Acceptance Criteria

To be considered complete:

  • Automated tests run successfully
  • Failures are clearly reported
  • Coverage includes core flows
  • Tests can be re-run consistently
  • Output is understandable by non-developers
